Text.val: Author: Stephan Huppertz
02.10.2014 SH SCR19188 Extended logic to retrieve email/filemail addresses via UFB598 (from table REPD)
24.09.2014 SH SCR19067 Set report language to "GB" if called from BXA412
01.07.2013 GB SCR18242 Extended handling: If V.RECIPIENT_LANGUAGE = blank then set V.RECIPIENT_LANGUAGE = 'GB'
26.04.2013 JH SCR18105 Removed external flag
27.08.2012 GB SCR17502 Stripped all illegal characters from PI.ATTACHMENT_NAME.
09.06.2011 JH SCR16507 Deleted GNRL_LANGUAGE
17.04.2011 GB SCR16390 Changed updates if REPA_RECIPIENT = 3
16.04.2011 GB SCR16371 Eliminate GNRL_LANGUAGE
02.09.2010 SH SCR15769 Set v.Copies = 0 if V.FILEMAILADDRESS = blank, no longer
updated with OPERATORMAIL if empty
18.08.2010 GB SCR15738 Removed special part for office spain in the RP the
Write general to XML
18.01.2010 SH SCR15252 Extended update V.RECIPIENT_LANGUAGE (recipient=2)
if DEBC_ADDRESS <> empty then DEBC_LANGUAGE if <> blank else DEBH_LANGUAGE
09.06.2009 GB SCR14681 Extended special handing for CITY
15.04.2009 SH SCR14543 Added Email Info in case of requests for existing reports
24.03.2009 SH SCR14495 Set recipient language to 'GB' in case of NA1/NA2/NA3
22.01.2008 SH SCR14306 Removed blanks from V.ENCODINGFILE (ASCII)
28.07.2008 SH SCR13804 Added DEBC_LANGUAGE (uses instead of DEBH_LAGUAGE if
<> '' for REPA_RECIPIENT = 2 where DEBC_ADDRESS <> empty
12.07.2008 GB SCR13781 Changed condition for update DEBC_ADDRESS if
REPA_RECIPIENT = 2
31.03.2008 SH SCR135021 Extended special handling for country = 'ES' with test
on REPA_RECIPIENT <> 3
18.03.2008 SH SCR13481 Added special handling for PI.PAPER, PI.EMAIL in case of
client office = 'ES' and GSET_YESNO(6010)='Y'
15.10.2007 SH SCR12994 Changed test to update v.ADMNO_NAME for spain office
17.08.2007 SH SCR12819 Added HOFF_NAMEONLETTERS, uses to update
v.ADMNO_NAME in case of GNRL_CODE = NL and REPA_CLNTNO = 8010
16.08.2007 SH SCR12814 Extended update of v.ADMNO_NAME for client 8010
02.07.2007 SH SCR12660 Extended language handling for belgium dialects --> VL/WA
19.02.2007 SH SCR12308 Increased length of PI.EMAIL/FILE/FTP ADDRESS from
alpha 50 to 255 since BXA302 passes combined address fields
16.09.2006 SH SCR12014 Changed PO.REPORTLANGUAGE into PIO.REPORTLANGUAGE
and extended the update of the recipient language with the value of the paramete
in case of recipients 9, 10, 11
21.09.2006 SH SCR11856 Added test DEBC_DATDELETED = null() where DEBC is fetched
08.09.2006 SH SCR11726 Added PI.NUMBEROFCOPIES to argument list of GB425 call
10.05.2006 SH SCR10919 Extended update of v.COUNTRY = blank with "<> 'BE' " test
05.05.2006 SH SCR11065 Extended updates of <queue_name> for email
to use "mail_batch"
27.04.2006 SH SCR11051 Extended updates of V.RECIPIENT_LANGUAGE
if REPA_RECIPIENT = 1 or 5 and REPA_RPRT_TYPE = 'MAB'
26.04.2006 SH SCR11049 Removed test PI.PRINTERQUEUE = blank to perform
GB425 and added PI.PRINTERQUEUE to GB425
18.04.2006 SH SCR10836 Extended test to perform GB425 with PI.PRINTERQUEUE = ''
13.04.2006 SH SCR10836 Extended delivery type for print with a new attribute -->
driver = "mydriver", triggered by GB425
12.04.2006 SH SCR10919 Extended update of v.COUNTRY = blank if
v.COUNTRY = HOFF_HADR_COUNTRY
12.04.2006 SH SCR10918 Extended update of PO.REPORTLANGUAGE with
GNRL_LANGUAGE if empty and added special update to V.RECIPIENT_LANGUAGE
in case of REPA_RECIPEINT = 1 and client language <> 'FR' and ....
07.04.2006 SH SCR10826 Added hadnling for REPA_RECIPIENT = 8
03.04.2006 SH SCR10863 Added second delivery type handling for print
16.12.2005 SH SCR9821 Extended part to skip writing of delivery part from
V.COPIES = 0 to V.COPIES = 0 or REPA_HIDEONWEBSITE = Y and
REPA_RECIPIENT = 1
13.12.2005 SH SCR9753 Changed test to use v.COUNTRY for foreign countries to
v.COUNTRY <> ADMN_COUNTRYCODE, instead of <> GNRL_CODE
22.11.2005 SH SCR9482 Added handling for REPA_RECIPIENT = 7
11.11.2005 SH SCR9425 Extended writing of tag <.... sort="city" / "country">
for OPL reports in case of PI.SEQUNECE = 9 (country sort)
07.09.2005 SHSCR9020 Changed conditions to set delivery types 5 (Email_XML) and
6 (Email), see SCR for more details
12.08.2005 SH SCR8815 Added part to prepare city/street if recipient = 3 and
REPA_INFS_CODE = GSET_INFSCODE (GSET_ID = 14)
22.03.2005 SH SCR8023 Added PI.JOURNALNO to messages which will be written to
log file
15.03.2005 SH SCR7967 Added CFTP_TYPE = 1 to part where CFTP has to be selected
05.01.2005 SH SCR7551 Extented special queue handling for PL with --> or
first 3 charaters of PI.START_PROGRAM = 'ICA'
14.12.2004 SH SCR7504 Added new argument for GB035 PO.EMAIL = skip
10.08.2004 SH SCR6731 Added new logic to get DEBH values if recipient = 2
08.06.2004 SH SCR6363 Removed update of PI.FILEMAILADDRESS again because
now there are problems with lawyer files.
08.06.2004 SH SCR6363 Set PI.FILEMAILADDRESS = blank if PI.EMAIL = 'N' and
PI.START_PROGRAM <> 'ICA8**' (requested via internet)
07.06.2004 SH SCR6363 Removed update PI.FILEMAILADDRESS='' if PI.MAIL='N'
02.06.2004 SH SCR6329 Set PI.EMAILADDRESS, PI.FILEEMAILADDRESS, PI.FAX and
- PI.FTP to blank if the related indicators (PI.EMAIL, PI.FAX, PI.FTP) = 'N'
Addtionally the parameters have to be also set to blank if v.COPIES = 0, means
the report was only requested for the archive
26.03.2004 SH SCR5818 Fixed bug with printing User/PWD/HOST if PI.FTP = 'Y'
18.03.2004 SH SCR5746 Added special handling for printer queue if GNRL_CODE =
- 'DE' and REPA_DUNNINGLETTERCODE = '099'
18.03.2004 SH SCR5742 Added special handling for FTP address if PI.FTPADDRESS
- <> '', then PI.FTP_ADDRESS will be used instead of CLIENT FTP values
15.03.2004 SH SCR5700 Changed special queue handlling for 'PL' if report was
- requested from an online program, now 'heller' will be used
15.03.2004 SH SCR5683 Undo changes of <sort> from 12.03.2004
12.03.2004 SH SCR5683 Changed <sort> if PI.SEQUENCE = 4 to 'address/city'
@This a new version of BXA900 included all modifications,
specially regarding to the SCR (s), of the old version. This new version
based on the BXA900 from 03.03.2005, which had to be redesigned!
====== Working fields ======
-- Uses to set the code pages dynamically for diff. countries
-- Uses to handle the different delivery types (INFO: Multiple types possibel)
-- Uses to extend v.DELIVERYTYPE_8.1 with SERVER_ID and PRINTER_NAME
-- Uses to handle the different queue names regarding to the delivery types
-- Contains error code if an error occured during execution BXA900
-- Write contents of parameters to variables, because in the the following steps
-- it could happened that the variables have to be changed !
-- Set the following variables to blank to avoid invalid interpretation of
-- Tamino header
-- Get queues which has to be used for the diff. delivery types
-- Only if REPA_RECIPIENT = 1 or 5 and REPA_RPRT_TYPE = MAB
-- Only if REPA-RECIPIENT = 2
-- Only if REPA-RECIPIENT = 2
-- Only if REPA-RECIPIENT = 2, variables will be set by task "Get DEBH values.."
-- Only if REPA_RECIPIENT =3 and REPA-BANKID = 0
-- Only if REPA_RECIPIENT =3 and REPA-BANKID <> 0
-- Only if REPA_RECIPIENT =4
-- Only if REPA_RECIPIENT =7
-- Always needed
-- Only if ADMN_ADMNINITRATION <> ADMN_ADMNOGLPACKAGE from the first Link
-- Always in use
... check if attachment for email has to be zipped, if at least zipping is
defined for one email address, the attachment will be zipped for all
email addresses
- Only if PI.FTP ='Y' and PI.FTP_ADDRESS = ''
(CFTP_TYPE = 1 --> to client)
-- Get default encoding with GSET_ID = 9, if PI.ENCODING = 0
-- Uses for <encoding_text>
-- Get encoding with GSET_ID = 12 for <encoding>, see first line in XML file
-- uses for BXA900A - Prepare delivery type(s) for print
-- Encoding for tag <ENCODINGFILE>, start of XML file
... Set default encoding
... Set encoding pages regarding to the settings in GSET
-- If v.ENCODINGFILE = '', the updates aboved failed, maybe the database was not
avaliable or there are no contents, then we have to use the hardcoded
code page 'ISO-8895-1'
-- Encoding for tag <" encoding_text=">
... Set encoding pages regarding to the settings in GSET
-- Initialize reporttype which has to be printed to XML
use as default report type REPA_TAMINOSTYLESHEET
... if it's emtpy use REPA_RPRT_TYPE
-- Initialize administration name
... special handling for country = ES
-- Prepare email address
... fetch email addresses from COUM
... fetch email addresses from REPD
-- Prepare file mail address ('A' = ASCII, 'X' = XML)
... fetch email addresses from COUM
... fetch email addresses from REPD
-- Special tests if v.EMAILADDRESS or v.FILEMAILADDRESS = empty
... 1. Test
... 2. Test, set addresses = [MAGIC_LOGICAL_NAMES]OPERATORMAIL
... v.FILEMAILADDRESS is still empty, v.Copies is set to 0 in the queue handling
part, see below
-- Prepare FTP address
... use PI.FTP address if sending from calling programs (f.i. BXA053)
... use CLIENT FTP address
-- Prepare variables for XML regarding to the recipient
(possible values of REPA_RECIPIENT = 1,2,3,4,5)
... for REPA_RECIPIENT = 3
... for REPA_RECIPIENT = 4
... for REPA_RECIPIENT = 2
... get DEBH values with REPA_DEBH by default
... if DEBC_DEBHBUYGROUP > 0 and DULD_VERIFICATIONLETTER <>'Y' determine who
should recieve the dunning letter
... with DEBC_DEBH
... with DEBC_DEBHBUYINGGROUP
-- Prepare fields for report
... if debtor client address = empty use debtor heller address
.. use house address if postal address is empty
... else use postal address
... if debtor client address <> empty use this for generating XML
... for REPA_RECIPIENT = 1
... exception for report language in case of dunning letters
... for REPA_RECIPIENT = 5
... exception for report language in case of dunning letters
... for REPA_RECIPIENT = 7
... for REPA_RECIPIENT = 8
-- SPECIAL handlings ...
... in case of recipient 9, 10,11 (see BXA435) the recipient handling is
implemented in the individual BXA programs, in this case set the prepared
language of those BXA programs (for info: recipient language is used to fetch
the correct stylesheet in recipient language)
... use language GB in case of NA1/NA2/NA3 files (no translations required by
tamino)
... if V.RECIPIENT_LANGUAGE = blank then set V.RECIPIENT_LANGUAGE = 'GB'
... if called from BXA412 set language to 'GB'
-- in case of Belgium the reports have to be printed in language (dialect) = VL
or WA ....
.. some of the BXA programs switch the system language to the recipient language
therefore the output parameter has to be updated (f.e. BXA001, BXA100,...)
.. for sure use always 'GB' for report language if no report language
was prepared
... if it's not a foreign country the country has not be written to XML
... get the country description for v.COUNTRY only if it's a foreign country
...Extend <recipient_language> if PI.FILE = 'A' or 'X' with encoding information
... special using of v.NAME if XML file was requested from an online program
... Clear v.CITY if variable contains only a '.'; for some cases the users
enters a '.', which means it's an empty city
... If REPA_HOFF_CODE = DE and V.COUNTRY = DE or CH or AT
Call BDH406 with PI.IN = V.CITY and PI.TYPE = O
V.CITY must be updated with PO.OUT
-- Strip reserverd XML characters
-- Strip all illegal characters from PI.ATTACHMENT_NAME
-- Queue handling
... calculate number of copies which have to be created
... if v.FILEMAILADDRESS is empty set copies = 0
... set virtual queue names
-- Extended queue handling for PI.SPECIALDELIVERY = 1 or 2
... use queue for central printer (2)
... use queue for user printer (1)
-- If a special delivery is in use PI.SPECIALDELIVERY > 0 then the following
-- parameters have to be updated, to make sure that delivery type = PRINT
... not in case of client office = spain (ES) --> see Specials in R.P.
-- Special extended queue handling
... in case of email attachments have to be zipped (PI.EMAIL = Y) , the queue
"mail_batch" has to be used
-- Set delivery type for report
-- BXA900A - Prepare delivery types
1. Two print types
... in case of copies have to be printed, they have to be printed always on the
second printer, only one document has to be printed on the first printer
-- first delivery type for print
-- second delivery type for print
2. One print type
.. print will be sent to local printer, has to be used for v.DELIVERYTYPE_8.1
( END MODULE --> BXA900A - Prepare delivery types)
-- If there are no copies, do not print the hole queue part, therefore we
-- update all delivery variables with blank
(INFO: The XML file has to be produced only for the archive)
-- additionally the following fields have to be also updated with blank, if the
report has to be only created for the archive
-- Error handling
... No queues defined for delivery types
-- Turn job to message wait, if an error occured
-- Perform a rollback if job is running on PC Client
-- Produce XML file for non existing files
-- in case of OPL reports (PI.REPORTSTRING = 'OPL' --> called from BXA002) a
special sort has to be used for XML
-- Produce XML file for already produced XML files
... check for existing email part, already written in calling program, extension
of email part = INF

ExpSyntax.val: MlsTrans ('Taminoqueue for FTP ASCII not defined')&' - '&MlsTrans ('Journal number:')&' '&Trim (Str ({1,1},'9'))
MlsTrans ('Taminoqueue for FTP XML not defined')&' - '&MlsTrans ('Journal number:')&' '&Trim (Str ({1,1},'9'))
MlsTrans ('Taminoqueue for FTP (PDF) not defined')&' - '&MlsTrans ('Journal number:')&' '&Trim (Str ({1,1},'9'))
MlsTrans ('Taminoqueue for EMAIL ASCII not defined')&' - '&MlsTrans ('Journal number:')&' '&Trim (Str ({1,1},'9'))
MlsTrans ('Taminoqueue for EMAIL XML not defined')&' - '&MlsTrans ('Journal number:')&' '&Trim (Str ({1,1},'9'))
MlsTrans ('Taminoqueue for EMAIL (PDF) not defined')&' - '&MlsTrans ('Journal number:')&' '&Trim (Str ({1,1},'9'))
MlsTrans ('Taminoqueue for FAX not defined')&' - '&MlsTrans ('Journal number:')&' '&Trim (Str ({1,1},'9'))
MlsTrans ('Taminoqueue for PRINT 1 not defined')&' - '&MlsTrans ('Journal number:')&' '&Trim (Str ({1,1},'9'))
MlsTrans ('Taminoqueue for PRINT 2 not defined')&' - '&MlsTrans ('Journal number:')&' '&Trim (Str ({1,1},'9'))

Text.val: -- Prepare user
-- Prepare password
-- Prepare host
-- Current debtor heller
-- Liquidator
-- Use queue "heller" only if XML was requested from an OXA/ICA
-- program for immediate delivery
-- Use queue "heller_batch" for printings if dunninglettercode = "099"
